item.title: 20 Nice and wholesome things to brighten your day, vol 124
item.description: Speaking of baby steps, I found that no matter how stuck I got, if I thought about it I could pour a glass of water and drink it.  Once I’d done that, I could brush my hair.  After that I could clean my teeth.  With those things done, it was like a reset button had been pressed, and I could try again with what I needed to do. Try it next time you get stuck. Let me know if it works for you too.

item.title: Donald Trump Faces Articles of Impeachment Before Christmas
item.description:
Congressman Al Green (D-TX) announced that he will file articles of impeachment against Donald Trump before Christmas. The Democrat congressman outlined alleged constitutional violations and demanded that Congress take action to impeach, convict, and remove the president. Probably 24 articles will be lodged.
During 26 years as judge, Congressman Al Green served as president of the Houston Branch of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) for approximately ten years.
Orange crappy-pants has nothing to put on a resume. No medals, no public sector achievements, no academia, no sports or hobbies.

item.title: I make crochet tops!
item.description:
Do I make crochet items? Yes is this one mine? No. This is actually a bait and switch because I need your freaking help. I have met the crossroads where need outweighs embarrassment. I have been out of work for 1.5 years. It's a miracle I've made my finances last this long. I sold my car and bought something cheap and old months ago just so I could keep paying our bills. I have been on job boards applying every single day. I've had 70 applications on Indeed alone in the last 2 months, that doesn't even include other job boards like Connecting Colorado or LinkedIn, or direct applications. I have excellent references and only lost my previous employment due to a company-wide layoff. I have made it into the final interview stage a depressing number of times (including at the state level) and I honestly do not understand why I cannot find employment. I have asked for feedback and each time it's the same. They think I'm great and it was a really difficult choice but they went with the other candidate. I NEED a job desperately at this point. I have tried applying for lower-paying jobs so that I could get by until I land back on my feet but I am either over-qualified and they would not hire me or something else but I couldn't even get hired as ahouse cleaner. I am at the point where I need to be back in a good-paying job or I am going to drown and lose everything. I have a 10 yr old daughter I have sole custody of and I have ONE month left of bill money. I told her a few weeks ago that I am her Santa because we cannot afford Christmas. We cannot afford anything. Food Stamps are the only thing that has given me enough slack to keep paying my bills. I've used my savings, I've emptied my retirement accounts, I sold my reliable car... I got professional help on interviewing and resume building and I don't have anything left to try except to ask the public for help because I am drowning like I have never before in my life and I am really BEGGING at this point for someone to please give me a chance. I am intelligent, hard-working, and dedicated. Please I am not asking for a handout. I just need a good job. I will train to do literally anything. Just give me a chance.
GBMaker asked me to make a paypal pool and link it here. Thank you to anyone who decides to help me out. Every little bit is truly appreciated. That being said I really am after a job. I've always supported myself and am anxious to be back on my feet. In the meantime, I am grateful for you all. For every view and share and comment that may get me closer to that goal. And to those who are so kind to share a bit of what they've earned with me to lighten my load. Thank you. https://www.paypal.com/pool/9kmXNsMnuI?sr=wccr And here is my daughter's wishlist for Christmas https://www.amazon.com/registries/gl/guest-view/OE1J6CH8D2KY?ref_=cm_sw_r_apann_ggr-subnav-share_95HP1HCWHXTT6GT6F0AW&language=en-US Edit: you guys I could cry this morning. You bought everything on my daughter's wishlist and you've donated $650. I am so grateful to each and every one of you beautiful souls. I am touched beyonds words. I haven’t had a chance to read everyone's comments and massages yet, but I promise ill read them all and respond. Thank you!

item.title: F U Microsoft (cake day post)
item.description: Today, microsoft constricted emails to 35mb photos sizes unless they are on OneDrive. FUCK THAT! I had to manually resize them and upload them ( a task that was previously automated). This is so they can force users to use their storage. I don't want my data on the cloud (read: other people's computer). I've got a hotmail account with 5 letters... That is how long I've been on the web, and these fuckers have now decided to remove a functionality that has been there for almost 30 years. Welp.... Looks like Linux and Google won this round. I'm making the switch. Fuck you Microsoft!
item.dc:creator: kurvarVillain

item.title: No sexy time.
item.description: Edit: It was a minor surgery, wisdom teeth pulled. His after care directions say not to get his blood pressure up for a couple of days. The lingerie was a birthday suprise. I guess a sexy dance won't hurt. I just want to be careful. Edit 2: We lost our dog on his birthday last year but we're going to try and stay positive and try to have a good day. She's on our minds though.

item.title: Progress update time?
item.description: Another update on my progress since breaking my lower body and spine November 10th 2020! As usual I ask for kindness and understanding on my weight because I'm very vulnerable when I make these posts. While I was bedridden for 2.5 years letting my left leg heal, I gained a lot but it is coming off But back to the update.... I took my FIRST completely unsupported step in 5 years! It was messy and wobbly but definitely a step! A year ago I couldn't even shuffle my left leg forward while standing and holding on! I also now walk into and out of the YMCA pool twice a week by myself, and do chair yoga with some standing poses twice a week! Before this video, I had managed a wall sit in class. I say this to say... don't give up. They told me I'd never stand or walk again and now I just took a step independently. As always, I love you all, you beautiful Internet strangers. You are worthy. You are seen. You are beautiful. You CAN keep going. Keep fighting. And to those who live in the states, happy early Thanksgiving!

26 Imgur Creator Spotlight: @PatrickPriebe made this steampunk heart pendant. Check out their profile and posts for lots of other things they've made. Some awesome stuff.
27 Man Tax: Tom Burke
“It is well known that a vital ingredient of success is not knowing that what you're attempting can't be done.” - Terry Pratchett I try to keep my posts "good vibe zones". So, instead of finding the one thing in here you don't like and commenting only on that, also comment about something you DID like. Balance the negativity. Love you long time. So, I made a discord server. It's a relaxed environment where you can take/donate memes to the cause, play trivia twice a week, chat about lots of topics or about nothing at all. We also have Jack Box game night and are setting up movie night! Very laid back/relaxed vibe. Come hang with us. https://discord.gg/AWFV7FT3RQ I'm also on the imgcat server for updates & fun: https://discord.gg/TpjD37jgJ9 ***Also if you miss abbiistabbii's discord community good news! Here's the new one https://discord.gg/NPStJGgARq - where everyone's reconnecting, shitposting, and hanging out again*** https://ko-fi.com/mememuseumcurator Unable to work and pretty destitute. Feel free to leave me a tip. Those that have, y'all are the bee's knees. You've helped me so much. ***Tag me if you see an artist/creator you like whose work isn't getting seen as much as it should be! Or if you are an artist/creator and want me to post something of yours, DM me!

item.title: The 'Inca princess' was found high in the Andes, preserved for centuries by freezing temperatures, dry air, and low oxygen. Buried during the capacocha ritual, she remains one of the best-preserved mummies, offering rare insight into Inca culture.
